messages.title: From strength to strength
messages.content: Camden Green Party is growing with 1.5 million votes nationally and election of its first Member of Parliament.

messages.title: Choice in Holborn and St Pancras
messages.content: Since the Labour has continued its privatisation agenda, local voters have turned to the Greens for real opposition and for future thinking.

messages.title: Your vote for Natalie Bennett can make a difference in Holborn and St Pancras
messages.content: A call to action emphasizing the difference the candidate can make with policies outlined.

messages.title: Letter from Natalie Bennett, Green Party candidate for Holborn & St Pancras
messages.content: A letter introducing Natalie Bennett as the candidate, touching on a range of issues and asking for support and action.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Policies aimed at providing fair wages, pensions and benefits; abolish student fees and enable higher education without the cost.
Greens' recovery plan involves making the economy low-carbon with insulation for all.
Stop privatisation of public services and restore a public NHS.
Education policies include abolishing student fees, providing free school meals, and sourcing fair trade educational supplies.
Encouraging local shops and building strong communities, including free local transport for under-18s.
Addressing crime by tackling the root causes and ensuring a strong community in which everyone plays a part.
Ensuring fairer public transport fares to support a sustainable city.

issues.economy: The Green Party's recovery plan involves making the economy low-carbon with insulation for all.
issues.education: The Green Party would abolish student fees and provide free school meals for all pupils.
issues.health: The Green Party opposes NHS privatization and pledged to restore a public NHS.
issues.socialWelfare: Policies aimed at providing fair wages, pensions and benefits.

housing.content: Insulation for all - we want to insulate and make the houses of Camden, London and the UK 60% more energy efficient, reducing carbon emission; create jobs and lower bills.

contactInformation.address: Freepost RSLG-UHZK-UJHU, Camden Green Party, 56 Walker House, London NW1 1EP

endorsements.endorsement: Support and endorsement shown in the photo along with the candidate.

images.caption: Image of Natalie Bennett with Caroline Lucas, endorsing the campaign.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet provides information on the party's growth, key policies, and a letter from the candidate. It asks for support and offers a rallying call for fairness.
